area_name: Playtime is Over, Space Chubby, Salsa Verde, The Edge

content.description:
Nice big moves on perfectly clean rock. Start seated on the eroding landing, and shoot straight up through the cool features.

Finish kind of awkwardly in the slot/mantle/fin thing. Or at least, I finished awkwardly. You should finish elegantly.
content.protection: 2 pads, a spotter would be ideal
content.location: High at New Joe's. See Area description for more details, and consult Isaac Caldiero's guide for a good map.

content.description: Start on cool pockets, and move up and right to juggy top out.
content.location: On the Space Chubby Boulder, uphill side.  Only problem on this face of the boulder.

content.description:
Playtime is an awesome crimp, compression and core intensive line.  There are more than a few ways to do it which makes for a great, thought provoking line on good rock.

Start low with a right hand undercling, left hand edge.  An obvious rail above is used above in conjunction with the arete to the left.  You may be able to use your lower extremities to create leverage (kneebar or toehook, dumbass).  Topout is easy but may be friable.

One of the highest boulders on the hill but worth the hike for sure.  The boulder faces east with a touch of south-east thrown in.  Arete stays sunny all day.
content.protection: Nice flat landing but you'll want a few pads.
content.location: There are a couple approaches.  Either follow the 'road' up the switchbacks from Nerve Damage until you see a cairn on your right which leads downhill about 100 feet (I think it's at least 3 or so switchbacks).  There is also a good but diminishing trail from Area 51 leading past Pitbull Terror and Roll The Bones; keep going up the hill.  It's high up there but not as high as Salsa Verde.

content.description: Good moves on a clean face. Start standing down and to the right of a little boulder in front of the face and work straight up. More secure than The Edge, and the position isn't quite as airy.
content.protection: 2 pads, and a spotter, or don't fall
content.location: High in New Joe's, The Face and The Edge face uphill on a large, clean, slate gray boulder. Check the area description for more detail, and consider buying Isaac's guide for a good map.

content.description:
It's just like it sounds. Follow the right side or the left side of the clean and pretty arete, for fairly equivalent difficulty.

Great position, and committing moves on small feet make this a special climb.
content.protection: 2-3 pads and spotters, or really don't fall.
content.location: High in New Joe's. Check Area description for more detail.

pathTokens: Playtime is Over, Space Chubby, Salsa Verde, The Edge
